info.title: Genji Shimada API
info.description: REST API for Genji Shimada project.

get.description: Get the user's notification settings. If `to_bitmask=true`, returns the raw integer bitmask. Otherwise returns an array of enabled notification names.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

put.description: Replace all notification settings for the user using the provided settings payload. If the `X-Test-Mode` header is present, the update is short-circuited with success.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Check if user is a creator.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return a boolean indicating whether a user with the given ID exists.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

post.description: Create a placeholder user with an auto-generated ID and return the new user ID.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Fetch all users with their basic fields and aggregated Overwatch usernames.

post.description: Create a new user with the provided ID, nickname, and global name. If the user already exists, this is a no-op. Duplicate primary keys are reported with a 400.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Retrieve Overwatch usernames for a user. Responds with 404 if the user does not exist. Includes `username` and `is_primary` fields.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

put.description: Replace the Overwatch usernames for a user. This clears all existing entries and inserts the provided list. Use `is_primary` on exactly one entry to mark it as primary.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Fetch a single user by ID. Returns nickname, global name, coins, aggregated Overwatch usernames, and a `coalesced_name` preferring primary OW username, then nickname, then global name.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

patch.description: Update the global name and nickname for a user.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Compute per-difficulty completion counts and medal thresholds for the given user. Uses verified, latest-per-user runs and Global maps only.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

put.summary: Link fake member to real user
put.description: Reassign references from the fake user to the real user and delete the fake user row.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

patch.description: Enable or disable a single notification flag by name (e.g., `DM_ON_VERIFICATION`). The request body must be a boolean: `true` to enable, `false` to disable.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method
Bad request syntax or unsupported method
Bad request syntax or unsupported method
Bad request syntax or unsupported method

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return the user's badge settings with resolved URLs (e.g., mastery, spray).

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

put.description: Set all badge slots (1-6) for the user. The user_id in the payload is ignored if provided.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return full rank card payload including rank, avatar, badges, map totals, and XP.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

post.description: Create a long-lived token for persistent login.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Get all active sessions for a user.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method
Bad request syntax or unsupported method

delete.description: Logout user from all devices by revoking all remember tokens.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Read session data by ID. Includes is_mod flag. Used by Laravel session driver.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

put.description: Write session data. Used by Laravel session driver.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

delete.description: Destroy a session. Used by Laravel session driver.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

post.description: Remove expired sessions. Should be called periodically.
Check if a remember token is valid and return user_id.

post.description: Verify email address using token from verification email.

post.description: Log when a user clicks ona Map Code Copy button.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return a list of map codes ordered by exact match, prefix match, or similarity. Results can be filtered by archived/hidden status or playtest status.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return a list of mechanics ordered by similarity to the provided search string.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return a list of map names ordered by text similarity to the provided search string.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return a list of map restrictions ordered by text similarity to the provided search string.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return a list of users ordered by text similarity to the provided search string. Considers nickname, global name, and Overwatch usernames.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Transform a free-form input string into the closest matching map code. Results may be filtered by archived, hidden, or playtest status.

post.description: Upload an image or screenshot file to the CDN. The file must be sent as multipart/form-data.

get.description: Return whether the given `user_id` is included in the creator mentions for the thread and code.

get.summary: List Open Change Requests by Code

patch.description: Mark the change request associated with the given thread as having been alerted.

put.description: Accept or reject a map edit request.

patch.description: Associate a Discord message ID with an edit request.

get.description: Return maps matching the provided filters, including playtest status, visibility, categories, creators, mechanics, restrictions, difficulty, medals, and completion context. Supports pagination or returning all results.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

patch.summary: Archive or unarchive maps (single or bulk)
patch.description: Toggle archival status for one or more maps based on the request body. If `status` is `"Archive"`, the specified `codes` are archived; otherwise they are unarchived. Uses single-map operations when exactly one code is provided and bulk operations when multiple codes are provided. On success, publishes an `api.map.archive` message containing the request payload.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

patch.description: Patch an existing map by code using a partial update payload. Returns the updated map.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

put.description: Update multiple notification preferences at once.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Count official, visible maps per base difficulty (stripping '+'/'-').
Count the number of players per derived skill rank (Ninja → God).
Count the number of players in each main XP tier.
Return creators with ≥3 rated maps, ranked by average quality.
Return the top 5 maps per base difficulty ranked by completions (tiebreaker: quality).
Sum verified playtime across maps, grouped by base difficulty (stripping '+'/'-').
Count all maps grouped by map name, regardless of archive/visibility.
Count non-archived, non-hidden maps grouped by map name.
Return a paginated list of newsfeed events ordered by most recent first. Supports an optional type filter via the "type" query parameter and fixed page sizes (10, 20, 25, 50).

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

post.description: Insert a newsfeed event and immediately publish its ID to RabbitMQ. The request body must be a valid NewsfeedEvent; the response is the numeric ID of the newly created row.
